publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-262# Mr Nick Johnston: Scottish Gliding Union—That the Parliament notes the threat to the continuing use of Portmoak airfield by the Scottish Gliding Union, due to creeping developments affecting the runways and glide path.

S1M-262# Mr Nick Johnston: Scottish Gliding Union-That the Parliament notes the threat to the continuing use of Portmoak airfield by the Scottish Gliding Union, due to creeping developments affecting the runways and glide path.

S1M-262# Mr Nick Johnston: Scottish Gliding Union—That the Parliament notes the threat to the continuing use of Portmoak airfield by the Scottish Gliding Union, due to creeping developments affecting the runways and glide path.

S1M-262# Mr Nick Johnston: Scottish Gliding Union—That the Parliament notes the threat to the continuing use of Portmoak airfield by the Scottish Gliding Union, due to creeping developments affecting the runways and glide path.

S1M-262# Mr Nick Johnston: Scottish Gliding Union—That the Parliament notes the threat to the continuing use of Portmoak airfield by the Scottish Gliding Union, due to creeping developments affecting the runways and glide path.
S1M-262# Scottish Gliding Union (lodged on 9 November 1999) Bruce Crawford*

S1M-262# Mr Nick Johnston: Scottish Gliding Union—That the Parliament notes the threat to the continuing use of Portmoak airfield by the Scottish Gliding Union, due to creeping developments affecting the runways and glide path. Supported by: Bruce Crawford

S1M-262# Mr Nick Johnston: Scottish Gliding Union—That the Parliament notes the threat to the continuing use of Portmoak airfield by the Scottish Gliding Union, due to creeping developments affecting the runways and glide path. Supported by: Bruce Crawford
S1M-262# Scottish Gliding Union (lodged on 9 November 1999) Mr Keith Harding*

S1M-262# Mr Nick Johnston: Scottish Gliding Union—That the Parliament notes the threat to the continuing use of Portmoak airfield by the Scottish Gliding Union, due to creeping developments affecting the runways and glide path. Supported by: Bruce Crawford, Mr Keith Harding

S1M-262# Mr Nick Johnston: Scottish Gliding Union—That the Parliament notes the threat to the continuing use of Portmoak airfield by the Scottish Gliding Union, due to creeping developments affecting the runways and glide path. Supported by: Bruce Crawford, Mr Keith Harding
S1M-262# Scottish Gliding Union (lodged on 9 November 1999) Mr Brian Monteith*
